title: Domain 2.4: Summarize services provided by networked hosts.
content:

ğŸŒ DNS (Domain Name System)

Converts domain names (like google.com) to IP addresses.
Without it, you'd have to remember IPs to access websites.

ğŸ§  Exam Tip: If web pages arenâ€™t loading but IP pings work, check DNS settings.

ğŸ“¦ DHCP (Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol)

Automatically assigns IP addresses, subnet masks, gateways, and DNS.
Saves you from manually configuring each device.

ğŸ§  Tip: If devices have 169.x.x.x addresses, DHCP probably failed.

ğŸ“ File Share Server

Central storage space where users can upload/download files.
Uses SMB (Windows) or NFS (Linux/Unix) protocols.

ğŸ§  Tip: File server = shared drive (often mapped as a network drive).

ğŸ–¨ï¸ Print Server

Manages access to networked printers.
Handles print jobs, queues, and drivers.

ğŸ§  Tip: Can be software-based (Windows Server) or built into the printer.

ğŸ“¬ Mail Server

Sends and receives email.
Uses SMTP, POP3, or IMAP.

ğŸ§  Tip: Microsoft Exchange is a popular enterprise mail server.

ğŸ“œ Syslog Server

Collects and stores log messages from other devices.
Used for centralized logging and auditing.
Common in Linux environments.

ğŸ§  Tip: Important for security, troubleshooting, and compliance.

ğŸŒ Web Server

Hosts websites or web apps.
Responds to HTTP/HTTPS requests from clients.

ğŸ§  Tip: Common software: Apache, NGINX, IIS (Windows)

ğŸ” AAA Server (Authentication, Authorization, Accounting)

Verifies user identity (Authentication).
Grants access permissions (Authorization).
Tracks usage for billing/audits (Accounting).

ğŸ§  Tip: Often uses RADIUS or TACACS+ protocols.

ğŸŒ INTERNET APPLIANCES

ğŸš« Spam Gateways

Filters unwanted email (spam/phishing) before it reaches inboxes.
Can be a hardware appliance or cloud service.
Protects against malware-laced messages.

ğŸ§  Tip: If users complain about spam bypassing filters, check spam gateway settings.

ğŸ›¡ï¸ Unified Threat Management (UTM)

All-in-one security device:

  • Firewall
  • Antivirus
  • VPN
  • IDS/IPS (Intrusion Detection/Prevention)
  • Content filtering

ğŸ§  Tip: Great for small-to-mid businesses that want centralized security.

âš–ï¸ Load Balancers

Distribute network or app traffic across multiple servers.
Prevents overload, improves performance and redundancy.

ğŸ§  Tip: If one web server fails, load balancer reroutes traffic to another automatically.

ğŸŒ Proxy Servers

Middle-man between client and internet.
Caches content, filters web access, hides internal IPs.

ğŸ§  Tip: If a website is blocked or loads from cache, a proxy server may be involved.

âš™ï¸ LEGACY/EMBEDDED SYSTEMS

ğŸ­ SCADA (Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition)

Used to monitor/control industrial systems (like water plants, power grids).
Often runs on old/unsupported OS â€” vulnerable if not isolated.

ğŸ§  Tip: SCADA = critical infrastructure, often targeted in cyber attacks.

ğŸ“² INTERNET OF THINGS (IoT) DEVICES

Everyday smart devices connected to a network:

  • Smart TVs
  • Smart thermostats
  • Doorbell cameras
  • Wearables
